data.title: Second Annual Philadelphia Bookstore Crawl
data.meta_description: The first ever Philadelphia Bookstore Crawl in 2023 was incredibly successful, and the festivities are back for a second year! Over thirty stores will be participating in this all-day celebration of the Greater Philadelphia region’s thriving bookish scene. On Saturday, August 24th, book lovers are invited to explore shops from Old City to Germantown, Fishtown
data.text:
The first ever Philadelphia Bookstore Crawl in 2023 was incredibly successful, and the festivities are back for a second year! Over thirty stores will be participating in this all-day celebration of the Greater Philadelphia region’s thriving bookish scene.

On Saturday, August 24th, book lovers are invited to explore shops from Old City to Germantown, Fishtown through West Philadelphia, Elkins Park to Ardmore, and as far as Wayne, PA and Haddonfield, NJ.

This First-Friday-esque (but on a Saturday!) event challenges readers to visit as many shops as possible. Participating bookstores will host a range of events, giveaways, sales, and celebrations. Readers can also celebrate alongside a bevy of beloved local authors, from critically acclaimed comic book authors to USA Today bestselling romance writers, and maybe even get your book signed!

This year’s stores include:

A Novel Idea

American Grammar

Big Blue Marble

Bindlestiff

Binding Agents

Booked

Brave New Worlds

Capricorn Books

Children’s Book World

The DuBois Robeson People’s Center

PAT @ Giovanni’s Room

Harriett’s

Headhouse Books

Healing While Black

H&H Books

Hilltop Books

Iffy Books

Inkwood Books

The Last Word

Main Point Books

Making Worlds

Mavey Books

Miscellanea Libri

Molly’s Books and Records

Mostly Books

Multiverse

Neighborhood Books

Open Book

Partners & Son

Umoja House

Uncle Bobbie’s

Wooden Shoe Books

Sponsors this year include:

Running Press, William Morrow, Atria, Avon, Kensington, June Road Press, Tundra Books, Quarto, Avon, Quirk Books, and Harper Children’s.

Participating local authors include:

Sarahlyn Bruck (Light of the Fire), Nick Gregorio (Launch Me to the Stars, I’m Finished Here), Victoria Mier (Beyond the Aching Door), USA Today bestselling author Xio Axelrod (Girls with Bad Reputations), Jennifer Herrera (The Hunter), Dr. Melissa Ford (Their Example Will Inspire Us), Jadzia Axelrod (DC’s Hawkgirl, Galaxy: The Prettiest Star), Jiordan Castle (Disappearing Act), poet Boney Atlas, Dr. Mercedes Osakwe (The Enchanted Garden Affirmation Coloring Book), Lambda Literary Award nominee Alina Pleskova (Toska), Eshani Surya (Ravishing, coming soon with Roxane Gay Books), Joseph Earl Thomas (God Bless You, Otis Spunkmeyer), Laura Piper Lee (Hannah Tate, Beyond Repair), Annie Liontas (Sex with a Brain Injury), Katherine Vaz (Above the Salt), Elise Juska (Reunion), Lambda Literary Award nominee Emma Copley Eisenberg (Housemates), and more to be announced.

Exciting highlight events include:

An industry brain pick at American Grammar in Fishtown featuring literary agents and editors including Jennifer Herrera (David Black Literary Agency), Britny Perilli (Running Press), Liz Kossnar (Little, Brown Books for Young Readers), Eric Smith (P.S. Literary) and Leslie Zampetti (Open Book Literary). It’ll take place at 10am at the shop.

An afterparty celebration at Main Point Books in Wayne with acclaimed authors telling stories from 7pm to 9pm, with Anne Liontas, Katherine Vaz, Elise Juska, and Emma Copley Eisenberg.

A sneak peek at a brand-new bookshop opening in the Italian Market, Binding Agents, a cookbook shop that will open at 908 Christian Street. Molly’s Books and Records is joining in the celebration with Cosmic Writers, selling The Monster-Building Handbook, and offering a tour of the new space before it even opens.
